meanings.definition: A person who confronts someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The confronters bravely faced the challenge head-on.
meanings.sent2: The confronters stood up to the bully at school.
meanings.sent3: The confronters decided to have a friendly chat with the noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The confronters were like knights in shining armor, ready to battle any injustice.
meanings.sent5: The image of the confronters standing tall became an inspiration to others.

meanings.sent1: The confronters gathered to discuss their next move.
meanings.sent2: The confronters were united in their mission to seek the truth.
meanings.sent3: The confronters formed a band to sing about their experiences.
meanings.sent4: The confronters, like a pack of wolves, were ready to defend their territory.
meanings.sent5: The group of confronters moved in unison, a force to be reckoned with.
